body.p:
You must excuse
my remissness in not replying to
your kind favour received
some time since containing a
circular for the publication
of your works &c now my
dear friend I am under the
opinion if you should propose
to publish your own productions
separately, and issue a circu
lar for that specific purpose
you might succeed in obtaining
a large bit of subscribers, I
feel there are many persons
who would like to benefit you
in some becoming manner
and would subscribe liberaly

for copies of your own produc-
tions and lay accompanied
with a Sketch of your life and
your portrait to embellish the
first volume, and fix the work
at a definite price, so that
you might be well renumerated?,
and the other works you propose
to publish issue a separate
circular for, I will try and
do the best I can for you. I
should suppose Four Octavo
volumes 500 pages each large
margins and stout paper
would be capable if contain-
ing all you desire, and print
a page or two on the prospectus
as a specimen of the work,
then put in the hands of one or
two persons in each city, I can
see no reason why a edition
of at least 1000 copies could
not be sold, I will do all I can

for it. I am under many obliga-
tions to you for the prompt and ef-
ficient manner you executed my
order with the bibles I ordered for
Sarah & Leonora, they were high-
ly pleased with them, and considered
it a well timed present to each,
when you write, please let me
know the ? I will re-
mit you the amount.

Now for our congregation affairs,
I enclose you two circulars I
had struck off, I suppose you are
aware that Mr Jacobs has receivd
an offer from the congregation
at Savannah of $4200 to read
Lecture and Teach besides per-
quisites he does not desire to
leave here if we can raise a
reasonable amount for him, he
does not expect any near the
amount here, say if we can
raise about $2000 to $2500

we had a meeting on Teusday
last 21h rather thinly attended
there was about 1000 dollars
subscribed. Mr G. A. Myer was pres-
ent and presided all worked very
harmoniously. I have not the
least doubt the congregation
of Richmond will soon be con-
centrated into two, one Portu-
guese and the other German
as I contemplated in the circu-
lar, the Polish congregations are
“played out” and the new Ger-
man congregation will not be
able to sustain themselves I
understand, most of those two
elements will join us, and no
doubt those to wedded to the
German minhag will join Mr
Michelbachèl's congregation, I
do not now desire only one
congregation here I think two
will be better than there need

be no concenious? in regard
to minhag which might prove
very disastrous to us. I think
we will have a large meeting
tomorrow night, leading mem-
bers of the Polish cong. told me to
day that they will join us, I
understood that some desire to
join us if we will declare them
members instante with all the
rights and Privileges, they must
certainly think we are “Green”
as they out number us 3 to 1 or
more, and it would not take very
long ere they would oust us and
orange the whole system of loor-
ship, and we would be nowhere,
I they wish to join us they can
do so voluntarily and fall
into our lives as we are and the
next year if we give them the
right of membership we can do
so. My idea is for to do away

entirely with the election for mem
bers and after they have been a
contributor for twelve months to
declare the members provided
they sign such conditions as we
think proper to prescribe to as to
guard against any difficulty
to have no congregation meeting
except for the Election of Hazan
for the contributing members to
elect on any given day nine
trustees, a poll to be opened for
that purpose with proper inspec-
tors & to be arranged in ?
to serve three years so that an
election would be held every three
years for three trustees, the
trustees to arrange the whole af
fair of the congregation, to Elect
from among their number a
Parnass, ? secretary also
to elect Hattanim & Sharua? to
fix all salaries for the officers

&c &c, I want to arrange not
to have any congregational mee-
tings they always break up in
displeasure, from the fact, we
have no one here to manage
one properly, I want to arrange
if I can a system of liberality
and equality to all contributors
and have things to work har-
moniously if I can, I should
like a good looking plan of
your suggestions to carry out
my views, there was one feature
you spoke of when here, that was
a compact to be signed by all
who desired to be members, that
the minhag should not be altered
&c &c has been impressed in my
mind as a good article.

Hoping this may meet you in
the enjoyment of good health,
and may the almighty grant
you length of days in the fervent
wish of your friend—Jacob Ezekiel
